lexUnit.name: spearhead.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to lead (usually used metaphorically, with effort, plan, project, etc. as the direct object).

sentence.text: In the great majority of developing countries , such urban elites spearheaded the fight against the colonizing power .
DIY giant B & Q had spearheaded the four-year battle to open on Sundays , claiming Britain 's laws breach EC free-market regulations .
Reigning Belfast Marathon champion Gerry McGrath will spearhead the Republic of Ireland challenge and North Down are optimistic 10 K specialist Gerry Curtis will also take the starter 's gun .
A disgruntled postman rang up a radio chat show to complain , and found himself spearheading an anti-Florio movement that culminated in 50,000 people marching on the state capitol .
New Bristol & West director of marketing Ken Scott will spearhead the launch of a ` radical " new ` bespoke " product later this year .
Joan Brady , who lives in Dundalk and is spearheading the campaign in the Co Louth town , said there are plans to run a peace train between Belfast and Dublin next month .
GOAL machine Brian Deane was last night tipped to spearhead England 's World Cup qualifying campaign .

Sir Terence Conran , former chairman of retail conglomerate Storehouse Group and developer of the Bibendum restaurant , is spearheading the development of a restaurant and retail complex at Butler 's Wharf near Tower Bridge in London .
An attempt to bring Eyre to justice on a trial of murder , spearheaded by John Stuart Mill , was to prove unsuccessful in spite of the Lord Chief Justice 's eloquent support for his indictment .
The Lukac brothers spearheaded a second-period revival to take their team to 8-6 at the end of the second but Hawks managed to take the final period 3-1 and tie the game 9-9 .
Drawing on his experience , Sampson will also spearhead IXI 's assault on Sun 's user base with the Motif-based Deskworks toolset ( UX No 387 ) .
BATTLING Aussie goalkeeper Bob Catlin spearheaded a quest for a place in English soccer with a 25-minute video of his goalkeeping heroics Down Under .
David Rogers spearheaded Esclusham 's charge with a 21-4 victory over Nicky Jones while Dave Jones routed Gary McGill 21-8 to hoist Esclusham into third place with a match in hand .

Lenin was acutely aware of the ferment from below and the potential for an alliance of all democratic elements in Russian society , spearheaded by the proletariat , which would destroy traditional authority .
STEVE BULL faces a roasting from angry Leicester fans when he spearheads the Wolves attack at Filbert Street tomorrow .
Former world snooker champion Terry Griffiths , who plays for the South Wales CA Division Five side Burry Port , is spearheading a campaign for a new sports stadium in the town .
The internment calls were spearheaded by Ulster Unionist MP Ken Maginnis and DUP leader Ian Paisley .
Professor Kean , a specialist in diabetes , is also spearheading a move in the High Court on January 31 .
Allon , a life-long United fan , spearheads Brentford 's attack at Roker Park on Saturday .

A speculative report in the daily Critica said Major Moises Giroldi , the head of the elite Urraca battalion who spearheaded the coup attempt , had been killed in the dawn attack on the Defence Forces Headquarters .
